message.text:
End of year is the best moment to zoom out and focus on what truly matters: results, process, and consistency.
Copy-trading is not the same as copying - youâ€™re not copying tickers, youâ€™re copying a system.

Balancing a year is what we should always do: wins, losses, and most importantly the direction we want to go next.
Itâ€™s the right moment to check what copy-trading really delivered - across the longest possible time frame, not just the last few weeks.
Be honest: did we actually follow the strategy we copied, or did emotions take over?
In the end, only one thing matters - does it bring the expected result, and does it make sense?

I recorded a short video recap where I explain my approach:

DCA + rebalancing

long-only, no leverage

dividend cashflow focus

and why I avoid performance driven by hype (late entry is real for new copiers)

I also show my key numbers, and why I believe eToro is unique for copying a real process, not just ideas.
This is the part many people miss: eToro isnâ€™t just â€œa place to buy stocksâ€. Itâ€™s built for one thing - copying a real system, not copying ideas.
CopyTrader means you copy allocation, entries, DCA behavior, and rebalancing in real time. Transparency kills marketing - numbers first, always.

And one practical point most people ignore: when I open positions as the investor, I pay a $1 fee per position.
When you copy my portfolio, you donâ€™t pay this $1 per position fee.

Thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m here - not to compete in popularity rankings, but to run a disciplined long-term portfolio that can be copied realistically, even if someone starts later.

Watch the hands, not the mouth. âœŒï¸ğŸ˜

Thank you to everyone who follows and copies - your trust matters more than short-term gains.

How many basis points of interest rate cuts will we see in 2026?

Expectations are between -25bps and -50bpsâ€¦ I dare to place myself in option 4: -100bps or more.

message.text: I think likely 75bps but I am thinking we may see 100bps if all the numbers come in to allow it which I think they will.

The AI race in Europe is a race for green electricity and grid space. ğŸ—ï¸ 
Europe is bringing a knife to a gunfight.

The gap between the US and Europe is about kilowatts and cold hard cash. In the US, data center projects are hitting 500MW to 1GW in scale.
 In Europe, we struggle to get a fraction of that approved. Wholesale power in the EU is projected to be roughly twice as expensive as in the US this year.

Europe wants to lead in AI and climate. But look at the UK as the live case study. Theyâ€™ve realized that "green vibes" donâ€™t power H100s. To fix this, they are launching AI Growth Zones and finally nuking "zombie projects" that have been clogging up the grid queue for years.

My takeaway: If Europe wants to stay relevant, we have to stop obsessing over AI regulation for a moment and start obsessing over our "un-sexy" competitive disadvantage: high energy costs and 7-year wait times for a plug.

âœ…  The winners wonâ€™t be the ones with the best slogans. Theyâ€™ll be the ones who can actually afford to turn the servers on.

âœ³ï¸ Amazon launches Bazaar low-cost app
Amazon introduced Amazon Bazaar, a standalone shopping app offering mostly sub-$10 products, with some priced as low as $2, aimed at budget-conscious consumers in emerging markets.

âœ³ï¸ Initial markets and availability
The Bazaar app is available on Android and iOS across parts of Asia, Africa, and Latin America, including Taiwan, Hong Kong, the Philippines, Nigeria, and several Middle Eastern and Latin American countries, with more markets planned.

âœ³ï¸ Relationship to Amazon Haul
Bazaar overlaps heavily with Amazon Haul, Amazonâ€™s low-cost shopping initiative, but operates separately in select regions while Haul continues within Amazonâ€™s main app in markets like the U.S. and Europe.

âœ³ï¸ Competition with Chinese shopping apps
The move signals Amazonâ€™s push to compete more directly with Temu, Shein, and TikTok Shop by offering ultra-low prices, social-style promotions, and a dedicated bargain-focused experience.

âœ³ï¸ Shopping experience and logistics
Users shop with existing Amazon accounts, get two-week-or-faster delivery, free returns within 15 days, multilingual support, and app features like lucky draws, discounts, and localized payment and shipping options.

https://techcrunch.com/2025/11/07/amazon-launches-a-low-price-standalone-shopping-app-amazon-bazaar-in-over-a-dozen-markets/

ğ—ªğ—µğ˜† ğ—°ğ—¼ğ—½ğ˜†ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ˜€ğ—®ğ—³ğ—² ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—½ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ—³ğ—¶ğ˜ğ—®ğ—¯ğ—¹ğ—² ğ—£ğ—¼ğ—½ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ—®ğ—¿ ğ—œğ—»ğ˜ƒğ—²ğ˜€ğ˜ğ—¼ğ—¿ğ˜€ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜ ğ—®ğ—¹ğ˜„ğ—®ğ˜†ğ˜€ ğ˜€ğ—®ğ—³ğ—² ğ—®ğ—»ğ—± ğ—½ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ—³ğ—¶ğ˜ğ—®ğ—¯ğ—¹ğ—²?
In the world of social trading, "Popular Investors" (PIs) often appear as the golden ticket to effortless wealth. ğ˜”ğ˜¢ğ˜¯ğ˜º ğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜·ğ˜¦ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜´ ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­ğ˜ªğ˜¦ğ˜·ğ˜¦ ğ˜µğ˜©ğ˜¢ğ˜µ ğ˜£ğ˜º ğ˜´ğ˜¦ğ˜­ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜¨ ğ˜¢ ğ˜©ğ˜¢ğ˜¯ğ˜¥ğ˜§ğ˜¶ğ˜­ ğ˜°ğ˜§ ğ˜—ğ˜ğ˜´ ğ˜¸ğ˜ªğ˜µğ˜© ğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜¨ğ˜© ğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜­ ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜µğ˜¶ğ˜³ğ˜¯ğ˜´ ğ˜¢ğ˜¯ğ˜¥ ğ˜­ğ˜°ğ˜¸ ğ˜³ğ˜ªğ˜´ğ˜¬ ğ˜´ğ˜¤ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜´, ğ˜µğ˜©ğ˜¦ğ˜º ğ˜©ğ˜¢ğ˜·ğ˜¦ ğ˜£ğ˜¶ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜µ ğ˜¢ ğ˜£ğ˜¶ğ˜­ğ˜­ğ˜¦ğ˜µğ˜±ğ˜³ğ˜°ğ˜°ğ˜§ ğ˜±ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜µğ˜§ğ˜°ğ˜­ğ˜ªğ˜°. However, without understanding the mechanics of true diversification, this strategy often conceals significant systemic risks.

ğŸ­. ğ™ğ™ğ™š ğ™ğ™ğ™§ğ™ğ™£ğ™ ğ™ğ™£ğ™œ ğ™ƒğ™¤ğ™§ğ™ğ™¯ğ™¤ğ™£: How Risk and Age Interact
The safety of any investment is dictated by its "time horizon." A strategy that is "safe" over twenty years can be "lethal" over two. Two variables work together to shorten your window of safety:

ğ˜¼ğ™œğ™š: As you age, your recovery window narrows. You no longer have the luxury of waiting out a five-year market cycle to break even.

ğ™ğ™ğ™¨ğ™  ğ™‹ğ™§ğ™¤ğ™›ğ™ğ™¡ğ™š: High-risk assets create volatility. If you are forced to exit a position during a downturn because you need the capital (due to age or lack of liquidity), a "profitable" PI becomes a realized loss.

The shorter your horizon (due to age), the more "risk" acts as a catalyst for permanent capital loss rather than temporary volatility.

ğŸ®. ğ™ğ™ğ™š ğ™„ğ™¡ğ™¡ğ™ªğ™¨ğ™ğ™¤ğ™£ ğ™¤ğ™› ğ˜¿ğ™ğ™«ğ™šğ™§ğ™¨ğ™ğ™›ğ™ğ™˜ğ™–ğ™©ğ™ğ™¤ğ™£: The Overlap Trap
Many investors attempt to diversify by copying five or ten different PIs. They assume that because they have distributed their funds across different experts, they are protected. This is often a mathematical illusion.

If you copy five PIs who are all currently "outperforming" the market, they are likely all following the same momentum. If PI #1, PI #2, and PI #3 ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ ğ˜¢ğ˜­ğ˜­ ğ˜©ğ˜¦ğ˜¢ğ˜·ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜º ğ˜¸ğ˜¦ğ˜ªğ˜¨ğ˜©ğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜¥ ğ˜ªğ˜¯ ğ˜µğ˜©ğ˜¦ ğ˜´ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦ ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜±-ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜¦ğ˜³ ğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜© ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜¤ğ˜¬ğ˜´ ğ˜°ğ˜³ ğ˜ˆğ˜-ğ˜¥ğ˜³ğ˜ªğ˜·ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ ğ˜¢ğ˜´ğ˜´ğ˜¦ğ˜µğ˜´, you haven't diversified- ğ˜ºğ˜°ğ˜¶ ğ˜©ğ˜¢ğ˜·ğ˜¦ ğ˜´ğ˜ªğ˜®ğ˜±ğ˜­ğ˜º ğ˜±ğ˜¢ğ˜ªğ˜¥ ğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜·ğ˜¦ ğ˜¥ğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜§ğ˜¦ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µ ğ˜±ğ˜¦ğ˜°ğ˜±ğ˜­ğ˜¦ ğ˜µğ˜° ğ˜£ğ˜¶ğ˜º ğ˜ºğ˜°ğ˜¶ ğ˜µğ˜©ğ˜¦ ğ˜´ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦ ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜¤ğ˜¬. 

ğ™ğ™ğ™š ğ˜¾ğ™¤ğ™£ğ™˜ğ™šğ™£ğ™©ğ™§ğ™–ğ™©ğ™ğ™¤ğ™£ ğ™ğ™ğ™¨ğ™ : When PIs have high correlation (moving in the same direction at the same time), a single market sector correction will hit every "copy" in your portfolio simultaneously. True diversification isn't about the number of people you copy, but the lack of correlation between their underlying holdings.

ğŸ¯. ğ™ğ™ğ™š "ğ™ƒğ™®ğ™—ğ™§ğ™ğ™™ ğ™ˆğ™¤ğ™™ğ™šğ™¡": Diversification via Strategic Proportions
The most robust way to use Popular Investors is not to find one "perfect" manager, but to build a meta-portfolio that balances Conservative and Dynamic styles. The "safety" comes from the proportion of these portfolios, which must be adjusted as you age.

ğ™ğ™ğ™š ğ˜½ğ™šğ™¨ğ™© ğ˜¿ğ™ğ™«ğ™šğ™§ğ™¨ğ™ğ™›ğ™ğ™˜ğ™–ğ™©ğ™ğ™¤ğ™£ ğ™ğ™©ğ™§ğ™–ğ™©ğ™šğ™œğ™®
Instead of looking for a "safe and profitable" middle ground, split your capital into two distinct buckets:

ğ˜¿ğ™®ğ™£ğ™–ğ™¢ğ™ğ™˜ ğ™‹ğ™¤ğ™§ğ™©ğ™›ğ™¤ğ™¡ğ™ğ™¤ğ™¨: PIs focusing on growth, high-beta stocks, and aggressive sectors.

ğ˜¾ğ™¤ğ™£ğ™¨ğ™šğ™§ğ™«ğ™–ğ™©ğ™ğ™«ğ™š ğ™‹ğ™¤ğ™§ğ™©ğ™›ğ™¤ğ™¡ğ™ğ™¤ğ™¨: PIs focusing on value, dividends, capital preservation, and low-volatility assets.

ğ™ğ™ğ™ğ™›ğ™©ğ™ğ™£ğ™œ ğ™©ğ™ğ™š ğ™’ğ™šğ™ğ™œğ™ğ™©
The "safety" of your total capital is maintained by shifting the ratio between these two buckets based on your life stage. While a young investor can afford a 90% Dynamic / 10% Conservative split, an older investor must invert this to protect their principal.
By focusing on the proportion of these portfolios rather than just the individual PI performance, you ensure that your investment strategy remains profitable when markets are up, but stays "safe" when your personal time horizon requires stability.

Discipline and patience is my shield and sword

The biggest dividend lesson I learned as an investor

When I first started investing, I honestly thought dividend stocks were boring. Low returns, slow growth, nothing exciting. Looking back, that mindset probably cost me years.

What I didnâ€™t understand back then is that dividends are not about getting rich quickly. They are about building a system. A system that rewards patience, creates discipline and slowly compounds over time. Reinvested dividends donâ€™t look impressive in the beginning, but given enough time they quietly become a powerful engine.

Another big lesson was that dividends are not just for â€œold investorsâ€. Some of the strongest, highest-quality companies in the world pay dividends while still growing. Think of businesses like $MSFT  or $JNJ  â€“ companies with durable business models, strong cashflows and a long-term mindset. Dividends donâ€™t limit growth if the underlying business is strong.

Over time, I also learned how important diversification is. Different sectors behave differently in different market environments. Consumer staples like $MO  real estate companies like $O  , or BDCs such as $ARCC  all play different roles inside a portfolio. Together, they can create a more stable and predictable income stream than relying on one single idea.

For me personally, dividends are not just income. They are a way to stay invested, to reduce emotional decisions and to focus on long-term wealth instead of short-term noise. Slow, consistent progress may not be exciting â€“ but it works.

No financial advice. Just sharing my experience.

Have a nice weekend âœŒï¸
investoby

End-of-year discipline

As the year comes to an end, short-term market moves become even more irrelevant.
What matters is not how the portfolio performs in a single week or month, but whether decisions remain consistent, disciplined, and aligned with the strategy.
Liquidity management, selective positioning, and patience are all part of long-term capital allocation â€” especially across different market cycles.
Staying calm when others rush is often an advantage.

Dear all, I haven't posted anything because I was studying for this day, and this is today! Enjoy!

First I'll give you the conclusions like no one else does, and then the analysis.

âœ… CONCLUSIONS:
Small scale Nuclear Energy, Science, Technology, Big Data, Networks 6G, AI/AGI and Robotics will explode the next years due to continuous research and development, demand and supply, usage and need, and most critical due to competition between US, China, and Europe. No one will be left behind, who does will be left outside the international markets. This is what evolution history, and economic history has proven based on facts. 

âœ… ANALYSIS:
We all forgot how science, technology, and life was 20 years ago, and we let ourselves to be manipulated by traders and sorters, lobbies and other parties. 

âŒ There are some people claiming that "AI is bubble" without any objective reasoning at all. The same people are not analyzing how science, research and development, computing and computers, telecommunication networks, wireless technology, mobile phones, automobile, gadgets, financial analysis, healthcare prediction, and the rest of science and technology was 20 years ago!

âŒ The first reason is because they have nothing to do with science and with reasoning based on objective analysis.

âŒ The second reason is that they want to manipulate the market and move the trend from AI to other sectors on which they have invested.

âŒ The third and last reason is that some of them want to keep on sorting AI and Quantum due to extreme trend, and they don't want the sorting pattern to be broken. example: You can select the 4 quantum companies in the same chart: RGTI, IONQ, QUBT, QBTS and understand how they are sorting on the same exact moment all of these.

âœ… Lets move briefly and deeper to the big picture, with references so you can read about as well.

âœ… SPECIAL COMPETITIVE STUDIES PROJECT (SCSP):
â¡ï¸ The Special Competitive Studies Project (SCSP) staff assessment of the current state primarily concerns the geopolitical and economic competition between the United States and China in emerging technologies, particularly Artificial Intelligence (AI). Their core finding is that the world is in an epochal technological reshuffling, and U.S. leadership in key technologies is increasingly contested.

â¡ï¸ Key Assessments of the Current State:
- Technological Competition: The SCSP views the competition with China as the organizing principle of their work. The innovations of the last two decades occurred mostly in the digital realm; the next phase involves emerging general-purpose technologies in the physical (atoms), digital (bits), and biotechnical (cells) domains.
- AI Superiority: The staff assesses that the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) is executing a national campaign to achieve AI superiority, fusing economic power, military modernization, and global influence.
- Gaps in U.S. Leadership: The SCSP has identified specific "gaps" where the U.S. needs to improve its standing relative to China. In their 2025 Gaps Analysis, they revisit key areas such as internet platforms, advanced battery technologies, and next-gen networks.
- Need for a Techno-Industrial Strategy: The U.S. needs a cohesive, public-private techno-industrial strategy to shore up systemic factors across key technology sectors to remain competitive.
- Data and Talent: China holds an advantage in data availability due to its vast population and less stringent data management regimes, while the talent pool is contested, with China rapidly catching up in the number of AI researchers and engineers.
- Intelligence Community Urgency: The U.S. Intelligence Community must urgently adapt to leverage publicly and commercially available information and AI-enabled systems to provide real-time insights, balancing speed against secrecy.
- Generative AI: Generative AI is seen as a significant technological advance with the potential to transform the business of intelligence and create a new era of innovation power. Nations that harness this technology first will gain strategic advantage.

â¡ï¸ SCSP Reports:
- The SCSP's assessments are detailed in a series of reports and memos, which can be found on their official website (scsp.ai). 
- Mid-Decade Challenges to National Competitiveness: An overarching report detailing the landscape of the technology competition.
- Gaps Analysis Reports: Regular updates assessing the current state of U.S.-China competition in specific technology areas like AI, Quantum, and Advanced Manufacturing.
- Interim Panel Reports (IPRs): Detailed reports from panels on the economy, intelligence, defense, foreign policy, and platforms.
- Memos to the President: Recent memos providing specific policy recommendations on topics like AGI and Future Tech.

References:
https://www.scsp.ai
https://scspai.webflow.io/
https://www.scsp.ai/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Platforms-Placemats-02092023-1.pdf
